key_title: Key to the species of Brachyloma

source.author: Albrecht, D.E.
source.title: Epacridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Albrecht, D.E. (1996). Epacridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla white to cream, occasionally pink- or red-tinged in bud, the tube with 5 tufts of long reflexed hairs in the throat between the anthers; bract solitary, boat-shaped and caducous to leaf-like and persistent, distant from the two bracteoles
Corolla wholly pink (albino flowers rare), the tube with 5 reflexed pubescent fringed scales inserted below the anthers; bracts several, grading in size to the two bracteoles
Leaf apex with a pungent tip; corolla tube less than 3.5 mm long; mature leaves serrulate
Leaf apex with a blunt callus tip; corolla tube 4–6 mm long; mature leaves usually entire
Sepals ovate, 1.5–2 (–2.5) mm long, half to two-thirds the length of the corolla tube; corolla lobes 1.2–2.5 mm long; low suckering shrub rarely exceeding 30 cm high
Sepals lanceolate to lanceolate-ovate, 2.8–3.5 mm long, about as long as the corolla tube; corolla lobes 2.5–4 mm long; erect or spreading shrub to c. lm high
